text: You can never go wrong with these sweet and sour, cozy and warm dishes on cold days!
On rainy or cold days, what's better than being with your loved ones and sharing good food?
If you still don't know what to bring to the table during these cold days. Here are my three suggestions!
One key ingredient for today's dishes is Heinz Apple Cider Vinegar.
This Apple Cider Vinegar is made from fresh apple juice
which was fermented for 3 months in a 9-step process that ensures top-tier quality.
What's special about this vinegar is that
there is neither food colors, preservative, nor artificial flavors!
Heinz has built its reputation for over one and a half century now,
and I'm sure that not only me but there are a lot of people who are fans of the brand.
String bean and bacon salad is a very simple yet delicious dish,
especially convenient for when you're in a rush, but still want something nutrious.
Mayonnaise and apple cider vinegar give this dish
a very nice balance of rich and sour flavors.
You'll need 4 strips of bacon, 200gr of string beans, Asian basils
carrots, shallot and garlic
2tbsp of Heinz Apple Cider Vinegar
2tbsp of mayonnaise, 1tbsp of olive oil
1/2tsp of pepper, 1.5tbsp of sugar, 1/2tsp of salt
Remove the stem ends of the string beans.
Blanch the string beans in a large pot of salted hot water for about 30s.
Then transfer to an ice water bath.
Shred the carrots.
Blanch the carrots the same way as the string beans.
Strain the string beans. Finely slice on a bias.
Cut bacon crosswise into 1-cm strips.
Pan-fry until golden and crispy, then leave to cool.
Keep the bacon fat in the same pan,
add minced shallot and garlic and saut√© till fragrant.
Then strain them from the fat.
Rinse and chop up the basils finely.
Peel the shallot and thinly slice lengthwise.
Soak in cold water until crispy, then drain.
To make the dressing: In a bowl, combine mayonnaise, salt,
sugar, pepper, olive oil, chopped basils and 2tbsp of apple cider vinegar.
Mix well.
Apple cider vinegar is good for problematic stomaches,
since it contains acid acetic at 5%
which is a weaker acid comparing to the hydrochloric acid in our stomaches.
Acid acetic would decrease the acidity by increasing the pH level,
which helps your stomach digest food better with less effort.
In a large bowl, combine string beans, carrots, bacons,
shallot and fried onion and garlic.
Add the dressing. Mix well.
This salad can be an appertizer,
or a main dish for those who are on diet.
You should definitely try it!
On cold rainy days, a pot of Beef Stew with Apple Cider Vinegar will bring your family together!
The beef is juicy and tender,
the broth is layered and flavorful.
This warm and cozy dish is the best for winter!
You'll need 1kg of beef bone, 1/2kg of beef chuck eye roll
4tbsp of Heinz Apple Cider Vinegar
15g of corn starch
2 bay leaves, 1 root of ginger, 1 stalk of celery
2 carrots, 1 potato, 2 medium-sized onions.
Peel the onions.
Halve one and cut the other one into wedges,
then halve the wedges.
Cut one carrots into 5-cm pieces.
Cut the other one into bite-sized pieces (about 3cm).
Cut the celery into 5-cm lengths.
Peel the potato and cut into 4-cm cubes.
Soak in salted water to prevent from darkening.
Slice up the ginger.
Rinse the beef bone under running water then drain.
Grill or air-fry the onion halves, ginger slices and large carrot chunks
at 200-250 degree celcius for 30 minutes until charred.
In a pressure cooker, combine the grilled onion, carrot, ginger, celery
and fill with enough water to cover.
Stew for 35-40 minutes over low heat.
Cut the beef into 3-cm cubes.
Season with salt, pepper and stock powder.
Heat some vegetable oil in a large pot, add the beef and sear all sides.
Add beef stock.
Add 4tbsp of Heinz Apple Cider Vinegar.
Heinz Apple Cider Vinegar is made from fresh apple juice
which made them produce the most vitamin C, fiber and acid.
The nutrition from apple cider vinegar would help
boost your immune system and bring many great benefits for health and beauty.
Back to our beef!
Skim off the foam.
Add 1tsp of salt and 2 bay leaves.
Simmer over low heat for 1 hour till tender.
Add potato, carrot, onion and cook till soft.
Add constarch slurry and cook for another 5 minutes.
Different vegetables are brought together
in this Beef stew with Apple Cider Vinegar
making this dish extra nutritious.
A great choice for the whole family on cold days!
You can have this with either rice or banh mi!
Sweet and sour sauce is so versatile that it can even go with fried fish.
Sweet and sour fried fish can pair very well with rice!
Once you tried it, you can't resist to have more.
You'll need 300gr tilapia fillet,
4tbsp of Heinz Organic Unfiltered Apple Cider Vinegar,
2tbsp of all-purpose flour,
siracha sauce,
fish sauce, sugar, salt
chilli peppers, garlic, bird-eye chilli, coriander
Cut tilapia fillet into thumb-sized pieces.
Season with 1/2tsp of salt, 2tbsp of apple cider vinegar.
Leave to marinate for 5-10 minutes.
Discard the water if any.
I use Heinz Unfiltered Apple Cider Vinegar for this dish.
This cider vinegar is made 100% from organic apple juice
resulting in just-right sourness and a light taste to the dish.
In particular, Heinz Apple Cider Vinegar
does not contain preservatives or artificial colors.
In addition, apple cider vinegar helps
reduce and stabilize blood sugar level,
as well as improves insulin sensitivity in the body.
Good for those who are on diet or have diebetes.
Back to our dish!
Combine the fish with 2tbsp of all-purpose flour and toss well to coat.
Deep fry the fish till golden brown.
Remove and drain off the excess oil.
Heat some oil in a pan and saut√© the minced garlic till fragrant.
Add 2tbsp of fish sauce, 2tbsp of sugar,
2tbsp of Heinz Apple Cider Vinegar, 1tbsp of siracha sauce, some water
Stir well and let it boil.
Mix 1tsp of tapioca starch with 1/3 cup of water
and add in to thicken the sauce.
Add minced chili, garlic slices and fried fish. Toss well to coat.
Transfer to a serving plate.
Garnish with chili strips and coriander.
Serve with hot steamed rice.
This sweet and sour fried fish looks good and tastes even better!
Crispy fillet fish coated with perfectly balanced sweet and sour sauce.
What a delicacy!
I hope you like my three suggestions
for what to make for your loved ones on cold days.
Thanks for watching and see you in the next videos!
Bye bye.
